title: High-quality imaging of large areas through path-difference ptychography
authors: Jizhe Cui, Yi Zheng, Kang Sun, Wenfeng Yang, Haozhi Sha and Rong Yu
abstract:
Tilting planar samples for multi-zone-axes observation is a routine procedure
in electron microscopy. However, this process invariably introduces optical
path differences in the electron beam across different sample positions,
significantly compromising image quality, particularly over large fields of
view. To address this challenge, we developed path difference ptychography
(PDP), a method capable of decoupling path differences from the
four-dimensional data during reconstruction. This enables the acquisition of
high-quality, large-scale images, facilitating a more comprehensive
understanding and analysis of materials microstructure. Moreover, PDP has the
potential to promote the widespread application of ptychographic tomography in
the analysis of planar samples.
